results.title: Des Ensembles
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Heberrt and Suzanne Olivier
results.brief_description: A play on the colour, form and movement of two simple figures: a flower and a star. The effect is gay and lively, a constant surprise, but the movement has a mathematical precision as multiples of the figures form sets or ensembles, forming and reforming on the screen in absorbing, piquant harmony. A film without words; titles in French.

results.title: Des Enfants Gates = Spoiled Children
results.creator_credit: WDR La Sept Cinema, Michel Piccoli and Bertrand Tavernier
results.brief_description:
A famous director, unable to concentrate on his new script at home with his family, rents a flat in a high rise building. Instead of finding peace and quiet, he gets involved in the tenants’ fight against an exploitative landlord, and with a girl half his age.

Credits: Producers, Alain Sarde, Michel Piccoli, Bertrand Tavernier ; director, Bertrand Tavernier ; writers, Christine Pascal, Charlotte Dubreuil, Bertrand Tavernier ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Michel Piccoli, Christine Pascal, Michel Aumont, Gerard Jugnot, Arlette Bonnard, Genevieve Mnich, Thierry Lhermitte, Michel Blanc, Daniel Toscan du Plantier, Martin Lamotte.

results.title: Derwent runs down to the sea
results.creator_credit: Mobil Oil Australia, Tasfilm Productions, Linda Taylor and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Shows a canoe trip along the River Derwent from its source in the highlands at Lake St Clair in Tasmania. Explains the river’s importance in supplying water for agriculture, transport and power.

results.title: Dersu Uzala
results.brief_description: A fascinating epic by veteran Japanese director, Kurosawa, about the struggle of hardy souls to chart the wilderness of Siberia around 1900. Remarkable photography and the performance of Munzuk as an old native hunter carry the film. Drawn from the autobiographical novels of a military explorer.

results.title: Dernier Carat
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
In order to save her name and Stephane’s, Olympe negotiates the return of the jewels against immunity from prosecution. Boudot organises a television link-up between Paris and Montreal to close the investigation.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Dernier Atout = the Last Ace on the Deck
results.creator_credit: Andre Halley des Fontaines and Jacques Becker
results.brief_description:
“As if he wasnt hamstrung enough by a Nazi Occupation looming over his shoulders, the ambitious Jacques Becker, sets his first film, an atmospheric crime saga in South America! Two police academy students are thrown into deep water when they decide to investigate a criminals death - complicating matters is their arch-rival’ s kid-sister who wants to help. Amazingly, the novice Becker is already a maestro and pulls it off.” Reference: The American Cinematheque. Online. http://www.americancinematheque.com/jacquesbecker99.htm

Credits: Producer, Andre H des Fontaines ; director, Jacques Becker ; writers, Maurice Auberge, Pierre Bost, Louis Chavance ; photography, Nicolas Hayer ; music, Jean Alfaro ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Raymond Roulau, Mireille Balin, Pierre Renoir, Georges Rollin, Noel Roquevert.

results.title: Dermatitis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Dermatitis is a problem in many industries. This film shows how dermatitis is caused and how it can be avoided. Dermatitis in the home is also briefly discussed.

results.title: Derek Wickens: the oboe
results.creator_credit: Anvil Film and Recording Group, Ken Cameron and Muir Mathieson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Derek Wickens, describes the oboe’s complexity and how its tone is generated by its double reed. The history and range of the instrument is described with examples from Dvorak’s “New World” symphony, Richard Strauss’ Concerto for Oboe and Orchestra and part of the Haydn Concerto.

results.title: Derek Jarman's Blue
results.creator_credit: Basilisk Communications, Uplink, James MacKay, Takashi Asai and Derek Jarman
results.brief_description: Derek Jarman’s last film, made as he was dying from an AIDS related illness, is a devastating exploration of death and dying. Delivered in Jarman’s own voice-over, with assistance from Nigel Terry, Tilda Swinton and John Quentin, the film is a testimony to courage; it is also a farewell to love, and to life. By turns sad and exhilarating, the shimmering blue of the screen becomes a canvas across which the audience interacts with the essayist filmmaker. Jarman was one of the English-language world’s most daring, transgressive and experimental film artists and it is fitting that his last film continues his maverick’s love for exploration and the avant-garde. Right to the end, his wit and intelligence were undiminished. NOTE: VISUALS CONSIST OF BLUE SCREEN

results.title: Derek Ibbotson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Shows Derek Ibbotson, the famous British mile runner training, competing and relaxing in his private life.
